etymology.description: 旅(旅) (lǚ, "to travel; journey") + 行(行) (xíng, "to walk; to travel") = to travel
etymology.interpretation: The word 旅行(旅行) (lǚxíng, "to travel") combines the idea of embarking on a journey and walking or moving through different places. Together, they convey the concept of engaging in travel as a form of exploration or movement across various destinations.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢旅行(我喜歡旅行)。
夏天来临时(夏天來臨時)，我常常去旅行(我常常去旅行)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàtiān láilín shí, wǒ chángcháng qù lǚxíng.
examples.english: When summer comes, I often travel.

examples.chinese: 每次旅行都充满惊喜(每次旅行都充滿驚喜)。
examples.pinyin: Měi cì lǚxíng dōu chōngmǎn jīngxǐ.
examples.english: Every trip is full of surprises.
